tasks.task: Cleaning onions after harvesting. The subtasks here would be moving the harvested onions onto the conveyor systems, using brushes and air blowers to clean them, and then loading them into storage bins.
Sorting and grading onions. The subtask here is feeding the onions into automated optical sorting machines, which use sensors to detect imperfections and sort them based on size and quality.

Packaging processed onions. Here, the subtasks would be moving the sorted onions through conveyor systems, using bagging, sealing, and labeling machinery. They mentioned handling pre-cut and vacuum-sealed products, so that probably involves cutting the onions, vacuum sealing them, and then sealing them with heat or ultrasonic techniques.
Operating mechanical onion peeler. The subtask here would be adjusting the machine for the size and variety of onions being peeled and then operating the blades to remove the skins efficiently.

Processing onions for convenience products. The subtasks here might include peeling, washing, cutting the onions, vacuum sealing or freezing them, and then packaging them in various types of containers, like resealable bags, cardboard boxes, or vacuum sealed pouches.
Therefore, packaging would cover all aspects including vacuum sealing, heat sealing, labeling, etc. All these are part of the packaging process, so maybe that MAINTASK covers it.
